questions.question_text: An engineer set up and successfully tested a TEHO solution on the Cisco UCM. PSTN calls are routed correctly using the IP WAN as close to the final PSTN destination as possible. However, suddenly, calls start using the backup local gateway instead. What is causing the issue?

discussion.content:
Without the TEHO feature, the international call from the UK Phone to US PSTN (National-SJ) is more expensive because it is routed through the local gateway UK-GW, the call is subject to international charges, with TEHO the UK Phone placed a call to National-SJ is routed through the US Gateway US-GW, the call appears as national and therefore less expensive.
 https://learningnetwork.cisco.com/s/question/0D56e0000C4Mh8GCQS/tail-end-hop-off-teho-with-globalized-call-routing

questions.question_text: An administrator is trying to apply configuration changes on Cisco CME. When the users registered on Cisco CME to dial a local number to a PSTN call, the Cisco CME sends an incorrect number of digits. What translation rule fixes the issue and sends the correct number of digits?

discussion.content:
- Match and Replace Rule
 rule <precedence #> /match-pattern/ /replace-pattern/
 [type {match-type replace-type} [plan {match-type replace-type}]]
 type and plan match-type replace-type:
 - any - Any type of called number.
 - national - Number called that reaches a subscriber in the same country, but outside the local network.
 - subscriber - Number called that reaches a subscriber in the same local network.
 - isdn - Called number for an ISDN network.
 https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/voice/call-routing-dial-plans/61083-voice-transla-rules.html
 https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/voice/call-routing-dial-plans/64020-number-voice-translation-profiles.html#toc-hId--1155821062
 https://community.cisco.com/t5/collaboration-knowledge-base/how-to-configure-the-called-party-number-for-the-national-plan/ta-p/3122910

choices.D:
voice translation-rule 1
rule 1 /^4...$/ /2404\0/ type any subscriber plan any isdn
choices.C:
voice translation-rule 1
rule 1 /^4...$/ /9132404\0/ type any subscriber plan any isdn
choices.A:
voice translation-rule 1
rule 1 // // type any subscriber plan any isdn
choices.B:
voice translation-rule 1
rule 1 /^4...$/ /2404\0/ type any national plan any isdn

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A company needs to ensure that all calls are normalized to + E164 format. Which configuration will ensure that the resulting digit string +14085554001 is created and will be routed to the E.164 routing schema?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Drag and drop the commands from the bottom to the blanks in the code to implement a translation rule to allow only 11 digits to be received over a SIP trunk to a SIP provider. The Cisco UCM is currently sending calls to the Cisco Unified Border Element in E.164 format. Not all options are used.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
voice translation-rule 1000
 rule 1 /\+/ //
!
voice translation-profile STRIP-PLUS
 translate CALLED 1000
How did this answer get SOOO wrong. You have to use the \ "backslash- slants leftward or backward" as an escape character before you can use a +. EVERY IOSXE/IOS out there will ding you for not doing this. Also....this is the number that is DIALED...not the number that did the DIALING. So its CALLED, not calling. And of course, the rule is referenced by the number 1000.

straight out of my CUBE router...
HQ-Cube-RTR#config t
Enter configuration commands, one per line. End with CNTL/Z.
HQ-Cube-RTR(config)#no voice translation-rule 1000
HQ-Cube-RTR(config)#voice translation-rule 1000 
HQ-Cube-RTR(cfg-translation-rule)#rule 1 /\+/ // 
HQ-Cube-RTR(cfg-translation-rule)#
HQ-Cube-RTR(cfg-translation-rule)#exit
HQ-Cube-RTR(config)#exit
HQ-Cube-RTR#test voice translation-rule 1000 +12105551234
Matched with rule 1
Original number: +12105551234 Translated number: 12105551234
Original number type: none Translated number type: none
Original number plan: none Translated number plan: none

"Rule 1 \/+/ //" you need the backslash to null out the + as a special character
\ Escape the special meaning of the next character.

comments.content: Oh and "CALLED" because it is going out "towards" the ISP so it's the number the user "CALLED"

discussion.content:
rule 1 /+/ // searches the dialed string for ‘+’ and changes it to null (i.e., removes it)

Last line should be:
translate called 1000

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/voice/call-routing-dial-plans/64020-number-voice-translation-profiles.html#toc-hId-672735434

comments.content: Rule 1 should be "1 /\+/ //". You have to escape the + or the CUBE interprets it as regex. Tested this on my CUBE to sanity check.

discussion.content:
With globalization, Cisco CUCM can route international calls to the PSTN in +E.164 format using a + prefix instead of the international code. When you configure the external phone number mask in this format, no Digit prefixes are required for AAR group and no worries about the international code that should be prefixed. To localize the called party numbers so that the + prefix will be replaced with the appropriate international code, for example for US Phone the + prefix is transformed to 011, for UK Phone the + prefix is replaced by 00, this is done by implementing Called Party Transformation Pattern for each egress PSTN gateway.
 https://community.cisco.com/t5/collaboration-knowledge-base/globalized-call-routing-demystified-and-simplified/ta-p/4767793

choices.C: Localize the calling and called numbers to PSTN format and globalize the calling and called numbers in the gateway.
choices.A: Localize the calling and called numbers to E.164 format and globalize the called number in the gateway.
choices.B: Globalize the calling and called numbers to E.164 format and localize the called number in the gateway.
choices.D: Globalize the calling and called numbers to PSTN format and localize the calling number in the gateway.

questions.question_text: An administrator is asked to configure egress call routing by applying globalization and localization on Cisco UCM. How should this be accomplished?
